title: LawLuo: A Chinese Law Firm Co-run by LLM Agents
abstract: arXiv:2407.16252v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) demonstrate substantial potential in delivering legal consultation services to users without a legal background, attributed to their superior text comprehension and generation capabilities. Nonetheless, existing Chinese legal LLMs limit interaction to a single model-user dialogue, unlike the collaborative consultations typical of law firms, where multiple staff members contribute to a single consultation. This limitation prevents an authentic consultation experience. Additionally, extant Chinese legal LLMs suffer from critical limitations: (1) insufficient control over the quality of instruction fine-tuning data; (2) increased model hallucination resulting from users' ambiguous queries; and (3) a reduction in the model's ability to follow instructions over multiple dialogue turns. tldr: 该文章提出了一种基于大型语言模型（LLMs）的联合法律服务框架，名为LawLuo，旨在为非法律背景用户提供接近真实法律事务所的咨询体验。LawLuo通过分布式协作机制提高了用户对话的多模态理解能力，并能够处理更复杂的查询和频繁的对话轮次，从而显著增强了解决法律问题的效率和精确性。
